review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra GÃ³c Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive:
(+) Excellent location is a major plus point of the hotel, you only need 4-5 minutes to walk to the central square. Besides, there are dozens of restaurants, convenience stores, laundry services, spa & massage... right in front of the hotel's main entrance.
(+) Despite not being a hotel belonging to renowned hotel chains or management companies, the hotel staff (receptionists, housekeeping staff, breakfast servers & security guard cum technician) all provide good and professional support.
(+) Breakfast is served well in a formal way and quite delicious on the high floor, allowing you to enjoy breakfast while admiring the sea view.
(+) The room, although not too spacious, still meets all basic amenities.
(+) The small and lovely rooftop pool is also a commendable plus point.
review.comment_negative:
(-) The air conditioning and hot water system in the room need improvement.
(-) The corridors are quite narrow and the doors are not soundproof, leading to noise from the housekeeping staff's collisions, making you feel somewhat uncomfortable.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
A nice comfortable hotel, 1 Street off the beach, but you can still have sea views.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  Good bathroom, with good fixtures, very good hot water, and water pressure. 
Very good elevators. TV was easy to operate. WiFi could be patchie from time to time.
Lots of cafes, shops, and restaurants close by. Very central to major shops in Na Trang.
Not a big pool, but it's a great place to chill after going out and exploring on a hot day.
Our room was quite during the night, only a little noise from guests coming and going to their own rooms.
Would stay here again.
review.comment_negative: Cleaners, although they did a great job, would ring our doorbell anywhere from 8.30 am to try and clean the room. I'm a night person and love my sleepin....

review.comment_positive:
The hotel is right in the middle of city centre. Very close to the beach which is the highlight of our trip. Breakfast is fine, the coffee served in the breakfast is fantastic. 
Front desk female receptionist (morning section) is really professional. She had helped us to book 2 days tour around the city. She also offer me some coughing candy when she observed me coughing through the day. Very nice and professional young lady.
review.comment_negative:
We got the problem of the plug, as our only universal plug was broken, we need to borrow the plug from front desk. It was just one plug available. We would like to recommend the desk can get some more spare plug for visitor in future. 
We didn't used the swimming pool as it too small for adult. Recommend to change it for children used only. Get some pool toys to cheer them up, since the beach could be dangerous for young kids. 
Meanwhile, the only running machine and electric bicycle in the gym room are broken. Unlikely we need to use them but since it's not working, let's get rid of it in replace with a pool table for family could be nice.

review.comment_positive:
- Location is very close to the beach, 3-5 minutes walking and you are there, plenty of restaurant around.
- Nicely working AC.
- Daily housekeeping, new towels.
- Spacious room with storage spaces.
- Beach towels rent for free.
- Comfortable bed.

review.comment_negative:
- Definitely not a **** hotel.
- We have booked early check in (09:00) and late check out option (2PM).
We have arrived there around 6AM after the sleeper bus journey and apparently early check in was not available.
We got our room at 2PM. We have asked for a late check out option but again - it was unavailable. 
- Not the cleanest room, the photo shows a shower after entering the room for the first time.
- Staff - very poor English, does not smile. Housekeeping was knocking every morning to our door despite "do not disturb sign".
- Smell - daily, higly unpleasant odour from the pipes.
- You have to pour the water for like 10 minutes to get to heat it up.
- Breakfast - should be called lunch; you got fries, rice, noodles, soup, chicken etc. 
Not very tasty. Staff does not fill up what is gone.
- Pool - only 3 sun beds, you got sun there just until 1PM.
- Bar - not open.
- Gym - just a treadmill and a stationary bike.
- Construction noises.

Afternoon guy had limited English and hence tried with other means to help as much as possible.

review.comment_positive: The front desk staff were fantastic and very helpful and nice. The bed was a very comfortable western style bed (soft mattress). The room was a good size. The location is very central and near to the beach.
review.comment_negative: There is zero soundproofing you hear absolutely everything from everyone around you. The shower was pretty useless, it came out as a dribble if you wanted it warm (no water if you tried to make it hot). The do not disturb button on our room did not work properly, it would turn itself off and everytime it switched itself off the bell for the room would ring. Housekeeping seemed to be short staffed as on the one day we wanted it and asked if they could comeback in 10minutes as my partner was in the shower we were told no they do not have time despite it only being 10am.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra GÃ³c Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive: Hotel was perfectly located. Surrounded by ample shops, restaurants (you must try â€˜Greek Kitchenâ€™ restaurant it was amaaaaaazing) and the beach all within a 10 minute walk. The hotel breakfast was average and was very limited for vegetarian options but it was always being topped up and food made fresh. The hotel room was a great size and our room faced the sea which was lovely to wake up with the morning sun. The highlight of our room was how incredibly comfy the bed was, albeit 2 single beds pushed together to make a double, so spent a lot of time having to push them back together, otherwise we had regular housekeeping, shower was always hot and had great pressure and we had everything we needed in the room. Big shoutout to reception and breakfast staff who always greeted us with a smile.

review.rating: It was an alright stay, not what I expected though.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Senior Deluxe NhÃ¬n ra Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive: So, I booked 'Senior Deluxe Room with Sea View' which was like the most expensive suite they had available at that time. I had it booked and I opted for this hotel coz I was desperate about having a bathtub and the sea view (not necessarily at the same time). This hotel looked like a perfect match and had good reviews so I didn't care to check the hotel on Google which panned out to be a mistake. My one of the two desires was a hot tub which wasn't available due to the lack of hot water! and google review actually warn about it endlessly. I didn't believe the reviews first coz there're lots of cheap rooms as well for as little as 8-10$ per night so that shouldn't come to you as a surprise that 8-10$ won't buy you much but I booked the best suite they had for like 40$! And still had no hot water. View was great, outstandingly cozy bed, mid wifi. The breakfast was also included which is a great thing for some (had no interest due to the mad hours, they serve breakfast at like 6 am and only for 3 hours). The room service rang at like 10 in the am and the bell was crazy loud, I wish the owners would try to relax when someone is waking them up to this siren. So, the hotel is alright but if you are like me and willing to have a quality hot bath, don't bother. The rest was absolutely fine.
review.comment_negative: Described everything above. I can mention only one more thing, it's when I first arrived I had to wait for good 10-15 mins before someone appeared to check me in. And there was no bell, no ring, no button to call the receptionist. Moreover the receptionist wasn't well trained, he was holding an envelope with my name on it and I was showing him my passport with my name and he didn't even care to look at it, he was asking for my booking instead, so I had to grab the envelope myself to point out that the name in my passport matches the name on the envelope. Like fam, why on earth would you need my passport and that envelope if neither is of any use to you!

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘

review.rating: A great location and Super comfortable bed..
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe cho 3 NgÆ°á»i
review.comment_positive:
The girl running the reception was a star. How understanding of the English language is amazing but she was also very helpful.
She pointed us in the right direction for a place to eat. She organised it train ticket booking. She made everything perfect. You are lucky to have her.
The room was cleaned perfectly every day. They always have us a smile as we walked past. It was nice to see the staff happy.
The bed was by far the most comfortable bed we have slept in in Vietnam.
The location down the side alley was a plus point for us. It gave us access to some of the cheaper eating options and very well priced beer.
It was only 5 minutes to the beach and 5 minutes to many other food options.
Do yourself a favour and google " German restaurant near me". Haus Bremen, That too is only a 10 minute walk and has great food, beer and a couple of tasty well priced cocktails. It was one of the standout meals we had while in Nha Trang.
Overall this hotel on a world standard would be rated as 3 star but it's a very good 3 star.
The pool was lovely but best enjoyed after midday so you can swim in the shade. It rarely had many other people using it works we were there.
The shower was good too. We lived the big shower head.
Air conditioning worked fantastic. Just push the on/ off button twice quickly to turn it on.
review.comment_negative:
The breakfast was passable but wasn't something great. It just needs to be improved. The ice bucket needs to be insulated at the ice doesn't melt to quickly.
We were there for 5 days but never where given the option of omelettes. On our last day we saw someone else get them. That's not good.
The ribs seem like they are meant to be Chinese style but they need more flavours. I've the was crumbed fish but it ran out and wasn't refilled. The crusty bread was always dry so we didn't eat that after day 1. The fried eggs were great. The fried rice was very bland but that seems to be the standard in Vietnam so I guess we didn't argue that item.
The coffee was good the tea was good. There was only the option for sweet condensed milk but it would be nice to have some full cream milk for the tea. ( UHT milk would be fine).
Like I said the basis is there it just needs to be refined and you would have a winning breakfast.
The room breakfast is held in needs much better airconditioning. It was very hot and uncomfortable unless you say I've one if the fans.
The only other problem we had was the pool decking is unstable. We saw some nearly hurt themselves when the planks moved unexpectedly. This just needs some maintenance for safety. 
There is a bit if with going on in the stairwell but it never worried us. It would only be 30 minutes if noise per day. That's ok. It will be fixed soon.
